content:
Diagnosis:		Bilateral metaplastic breast carcinoma

Management:		Right mastectomy March 2023
		Left mastectomy May 2023
		Adjuvant chemotherapy completed September 2023

Histology:		Right: pT1c spindle cell metaplastic carcinoma, grade 3
		Left: pT1c spindle cell metaplastic carcinoma, grade 3
		Both tumours PD-L1 positive with high TILs (75%)

Current situation:	Routine follow-up

[redacted name] attended clinic today for routine follow-up following completion of adjuvant chemotherapy for bilateral metaplastic breast cancer. She has made an excellent recovery from her bilateral mastectomies and subsequent chemotherapy. Her energy levels have significantly improved since completing treatment, though she still experiences mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips from the taxane chemotherapy. She has maintained her weight and has returned to work part-time as a teacher. Clinical examination today shows well-healed mastectomy scars bilaterally with no concerning features. There is no lymphadenopathy or evidence of recurrence. Recent CT chest/abdomen/pelvis from 15/01/2024 shows no evidence of metastatic disease. Blood tests including liver function are all within normal range. The plan is to continue regular follow-up with clinical review and annual mammography of the chest wall. She will be reviewed again in clinic in 3 months' time.

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: well-healed mastectomy scars bilaterally with no concerning features, no lymphadenopathy
blood tests including liver function within normal range
returned to work part-time as a teacher

status_updates.value: Bilateral metaplastic breast cancer treated with bilateral mastectomies and adjuvant chemotherapy. Now in follow-up with no evidence of recurrence.
residual mild peripheral neuropathy from taxane chemotherapy
